sentences.en: A majority of monetary officials is still striving to restore greater fixity to exchange rates.
sentences.cn: 大多数金融官员仍力图使汇率恢复较大的固定性.

sentences.en: Balance - of - payments deficits are increasingly financed by special drawing rights at the International Monetary Fund.
sentences.cn: 国际货币基金组织的特别提款权被越来越多地用来融通国际收支中的逆差.

sentences.en: Education in the wilderness is not a matter of monetary means.
sentences.cn: 荒凉地区的教育不是钱财问题.

sentences.en: Europe's monetary system is falling apart.
sentences.cn: 欧洲货币体系正在走向瓦解。

sentences.en: He has changed his stance on monetary union.
sentences.cn: 他已经改变了对货币联盟的态度.

sentences.en: He rejected the austerity program advocated by the International Monetary Fund.
sentences.cn: 他拒绝了国际货币基金组织提出的紧缩开支方案.

sentences.en: In old China, over 95 percent of marriages were arranged and on a monetary basis.
sentences.cn: 旧中国, 95%以上的婚姻是包办买卖婚姻.
通货膨胀使物价节节上涨.

sentences.en: Opponents of the treaty argue that monetary union will turn France into a vassal of Germany.
sentences.cn: 协定的反对者认为货币联盟会使法国沦为德国的附庸国。

sentences.en: She was in complete charge of all monetary matters affecting the household.
sentences.cn: 她全权负责一切有关家务的财政事宜.

sentences.en: The bank also collects and disseminates information on macroeconomic topics and international monetary affairs.
sentences.cn: 银行还收集和传播关于宏观经济论题和国际货币事务方面的信息.

sentences.en: The grand design of Europe's monetary union is already agreed.
sentences.cn: 欧洲统一货币的宏伟构想已经获得认同。

sentences.en: The International Monetary Fund bailed them out.
sentences.cn: 国际货币基金组织把他们保释出来了.

sentences.en: The'production'concerned must be evaluated in monetary and not biological terms.
sentences.cn: 有关“生产 ” 情况必须用货币而不是用生物学的单位来作出估价.

sentences.en: There were, however, a number of crucial flaws in his monetary theory.
sentences.cn: 但是，他的货币理论中存在若干关键性错误。

words.tran_cn: 货币主义的；以货币为基础的
[金融] 货币化；定为货币；货币铸造
使货币化；把…定位法定货币（等于monetize）
定为货币，使成为合法货币；铸造成货币

phrases.tran_cn: 货币当局；金融管理专员
稳健的货币政策；谨慎的货币政策
紧缩的货币政策；紧缩信用政策

trans.tran_cn: 货币的，金钱的，钱的（尤指一国的金融），金融的，财政的，财政（上）的
trans.tran_en: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country
